Attribute.Documentation: // The attributes applicable to a container instance when it is registered.

Name.Documentation: // The name of the container instance attribute.

Value.Documentation:
// The value of the container instance attribute (at this time, the value here
// is Null, but this could change in future revisions for expandability).

Ref.Documentation: // The name of the container instance attribute.

ActiveServicesCount.Documentation:
// The number of services that are running on the cluster in an ACTIVE state.
// You can view these services with ListServices.

ClusterName.Documentation: // A user-generated string that you use to identify your cluster.

PendingTasksCount.Documentation: // The number of tasks in the cluster that are in the PENDING state.

RegisteredContainerInstancesCount.Documentation: // The number of container instances registered into the cluster.

RunningTasksCount.Documentation: // The number of tasks in the cluster that are in the RUNNING state.

Container.Documentation: // A Docker container that is part of a task.

ContainerArn.Documentation: // The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container.

ExitCode.Documentation: // The exit code returned from the container.

LastStatus.Documentation: // The last known status of the container.

NetworkBindings.Documentation: // The network bindings associated with the container.

Reason.Documentation:
// A short (255 max characters) human-readable string to provide additional
// detail about a running or stopped container.

TaskArn.Documentation: // The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task.

ContainerDefinition.Documentation:
// Container definitions are used in task definitions to describe the different
// containers that are launched as part of a task.

ContainerInstance.Documentation:
// An EC2 instance that is running the Amazon ECS agent and has been registered
// with a cluster.

AgentUpdateStatus.Documentation:
// The status of the most recent agent update. If an update has never been requested,
// this value is NULL.

Attributes.Documentation:
// The attributes set for the container instance by the Amazon ECS container
// agent at instance registration.

Ec2InstanceId.Documentation: // The EC2 instance ID of the container instance.

PendingTasksCount.Documentation: // The number of tasks on the container instance that are in the PENDING status.

RegisteredResources.Documentation:
// The registered resources on the container instance that are in use by current
// tasks.

RemainingResources.Documentation:
// The remaining resources of the container instance that are available for
// new tasks.

RunningTasksCount.Documentation: // The number of tasks on the container instance that are in the RUNNING status.

Status.Documentation:
// The status of the container instance. The valid values are ACTIVE or INACTIVE.
// ACTIVE indicates that the container instance can accept tasks.

VersionInfo.Documentation:
// The version information for the Amazon ECS container agent and Docker daemon
// running on the container instance.

ContainerOverride.Documentation: // The overrides that should be sent to a container.

Command.Documentation:
// The command to send to the container that overrides the default command from
// the Docker image or the task definition.

Name.Documentation: // The name of the container that receives the override.

Cluster.Documentation: // The full description of your new cluster.

ClientToken.Documentation:
// Unique, case-sensitive identifier you provide to ensure the idempotency of
// the request. Up to 32 ASCII characters are allowed.

DeploymentConfiguration.Documentation:
// Optional deployment parameters that control how many tasks run during the
// deployment and the ordering of stopping and starting tasks.

DesiredCount.Documentation:
// The number of instantiations of the specified task definition to place and
// keep running on your cluster.

Ref.Documentation:
// The number of instantiations of the specified task definition to place and
// keep running on your cluster.

Service.Documentation: // The full description of your service following the create call.

Cluster.Documentation: // The short name or full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster to delete.

Ref.Documentation: // The short name or full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster to delete.

Cluster.Documentation: // The full description of the deleted cluster.

// The name of the cluster that hosts the service to delete. If you do not specify
// a cluster, the default cluster is assumed.

Service.Documentation: // The name of the service to delete.

Ref.Documentation: // The name of the service to delete.

Service.Documentation: // The full description of the deleted service.

Deployment.Documentation: // The details of an Amazon ECS service deployment.

CreatedAt.Documentation: // The Unix time in seconds and milliseconds when the service was created.

DesiredCount.Documentation:
// The most recent desired count of tasks that was specified for the service
// to deploy or maintain.

PendingCount.Documentation: // The number of tasks in the deployment that are in the PENDING status.

RunningCount.Documentation: // The number of tasks in the deployment that are in the RUNNING status.

TaskDefinition.Documentation: // The most recent task definition that was specified for the service to use.

UpdatedAt.Documentation: // The Unix time in seconds and milliseconds when the service was last updated.

DeploymentConfiguration.Documentation:
// Optional deployment parameters that control how many tasks run during the
// deployment and the ordering of stopping and starting tasks.

TaskDefinition.Documentation:
// The family and revision (family:revision) or full Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
// of the task definition to deregister. You must specify a revision.

Ref.Documentation:
// The family and revision (family:revision) or full Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
// of the task definition to deregister. You must specify a revision.

TaskDefinition.Documentation: // The full description of the deregistered task.

Failures.Documentation: // Any failures associated with the call.

// A space-separated list of container instance IDs or full Amazon Resource

Failures.Documentation: // Any failures associated with the call.

Cluster.Documentation:
// The name of the cluster that hosts the service to describe. If you do not

Services.Documentation: // A list of services to describe.

Ref.Documentation: // A list of services to describe.

Failures.Documentation: // Any failures associated with the call.

Tasks.Documentation: // A space-separated list of task IDs or full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) entries.

Ref.Documentation: // A space-separated list of task IDs or full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) entries.

Failures.Documentation: // Any failures associated with the call.

Cluster.Documentation: // The cluster that the container instance belongs to.

Endpoint.Documentation: // The endpoint for the Amazon ECS agent to poll.

TelemetryEndpoint.Documentation: // The telemetry endpoint for the Amazon ECS agent.

Arn.Documentation: // The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the failed resource.

HostEntry.Documentation:
// Hostnames and IP address entries that are added to the /etc/hosts file of
// a container via the extraHosts parameter of its ContainerDefinition.

Hostname.Documentation: // The hostname to use in the /etc/hosts entry.

IpAddress.Documentation: // The IP address to use in the /etc/hosts entry.

Ref.Documentation: // The hostname to use in the /etc/hosts entry.
// The IP address to use in the /etc/hosts entry.

HostVolumeProperties.Documentation: // Details on a container instance host volume.

KeyValuePair.Documentation: // A key and value pair object.

Name.Documentation:
// The name of the key value pair. For environment variables, this is the name
// of the environment variable.

Value.Documentation:
// The value of the key value pair. For environment variables, this is the value
// of the environment variable.

ClusterArns.Documentation:
// The list of full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) entries for each cluster associated
// with your account.

ContainerInstanceArns.Documentation:
// The list of container instances with full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) entries
// for each container instance associated with the specified cluster.

ServiceArns.Documentation:
// The list of full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) entries for each service associated
// with the specified cluster.

Families.Documentation:
// The list of task definition family names that match the ListTaskDefinitionFamilies
// request.

TaskDefinitionArns.Documentation:
// The list of task definition Amazon Resource Name (ARN) entries for the ListTaskDefinitions
// request.

Family.Documentation:
// The name of the family with which to filter the ListTasks results. Specifying
// a family limits the results to tasks that belong to that family.

ServiceName.Documentation:
// The name of the service with which to filter the ListTasks results. Specifying
// a serviceName limits the results to tasks that belong to that service.

StartedBy.Documentation:
// The startedBy value with which to filter the task results. Specifying a startedBy
// value limits the results to tasks that were started with that value.

TaskArns.Documentation: // The list of task Amazon Resource Name (ARN) entries for the ListTasks request.

LoadBalancer.Documentation: // Details on a load balancer that is used with a service.

ContainerName.Documentation:
// The name of the container (as it appears in a container definition) to associate
// with the load balancer.

LoadBalancerName.Documentation: // The name of the load balancer.

LogConfiguration.Documentation: // Log configuration options to send to a custom log driver for the container.

MountPoint.Documentation: // Details on a volume mount point that is used in a container definition.

ContainerPath.Documentation: // The path on the container to mount the host volume at.

SourceVolume.Documentation: // The name of the volume to mount.

BindIP.Documentation: // The IP address that the container is bound to on the container instance.

ContainerPort.Documentation: // The port number on the container that is be used with the network binding.

HostPort.Documentation: // The port number on the host that is used with the network binding.

Protocol.Documentation: // The protocol used for the network binding.

// The protocol used for the port mapping. Valid values are tcp and udp. The
// default is tcp.

Attributes.Documentation: // The container instance attributes that this container instance supports.

ContainerInstanceArn.Documentation:
// The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container instance (if it was previously
// registered).

InstanceIdentityDocument.Documentation:
// The instance identity document for the EC2 instance to register. This document
// can be found by running the following command from the instance: curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/dynamic/instance-identity/document/

TotalResources.Documentation: // The resources available on the instance.

VersionInfo.Documentation:
// The version information for the Amazon ECS container agent and Docker daemon
// running on the container instance.

Ref.Documentation: // The container instance attributes that this container instance supports.

ContainerDefinitions.Documentation:
// A list of container definitions in JSON format that describe the different
// containers that make up your task.

Volumes.Documentation:
// A list of volume definitions in JSON format that containers in your task
// may use.

Ref.Documentation:
// A list of container definitions in JSON format that describe the different
// containers that make up your task.

// containers that make up your task.

TaskDefinition.Documentation: // The full description of the registered task definition.

Resource.Documentation: // Describes the resources available for a container instance.

DoubleValue.Documentation:
// When the doubleValue type is set, the value of the resource must be a double
// precision floating-point type.

IntegerValue.Documentation: // When the integerValue type is set, the value of the resource must be an integer.

LongValue.Documentation:
// When the longValue type is set, the value of the resource must be an extended
// precision floating-point type.

Name.Documentation: // The name of the resource, such as CPU, MEMORY, PORTS, or a user-defined resource.

StringSetValue.Documentation:
// When the stringSetValue type is set, the value of the resource must be a
// string type.

Type.Documentation: // The type of the resource, such as INTEGER, DOUBLE, LONG, or STRINGSET.

Failures.Documentation: // Any failures associated with the call.

Tasks.Documentation:
// A full description of the tasks that were run. Each task that was successfully
// placed on your cluster are described here.

Service.Documentation: // Details on a service within a cluster

ClusterArn.Documentation: // The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster that hosts the service.

CreatedAt.Documentation: // The Unix time in seconds and milliseconds when the service was created.

DeploymentConfiguration.Documentation:
// Optional deployment parameters that control how many tasks run during the
// deployment and the ordering of stopping and starting tasks.

Deployments.Documentation: // The current state of deployments for the service.

Events.Documentation:
// The event stream for your service. A maximum of 100 of the latest events

PendingCount.Documentation: // The number of tasks in the cluster that are in the PENDING state.

RunningCount.Documentation: // The number of tasks in the cluster that are in the RUNNING state.

Status.Documentation: // The status of the service. The valid values are ACTIVE, DRAINING, or INACTIVE.

ServiceEvent.Documentation: // Details on an event associated with a service.

CreatedAt.Documentation: // The Unix time in seconds and milliseconds when the event was triggered.

Id.Documentation: // The ID string of the event.

Tasks.Documentation:

ExitCode.Documentation: // The exit code returned for the state change request.

NetworkBindings.Documentation: // The network bindings of the container.

DesiredStatus.Documentation: // The desired status of the task.

LastStatus.Documentation: // The last known status of the task.

StartedAt.Documentation:
// The Unix time in seconds and milliseconds when the task was started (the

RequiresAttributes.Documentation: // The container instance attributes required by your task.

Status.Documentation: // The status of the task definition.

TaskDefinitionArn.Documentation: // The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task definition.

TaskOverride.Documentation: // The overrides associated with a task.

ContainerOverrides.Documentation: // One or more container overrides sent to a task.

Ulimit.Documentation: // The ulimit settings to pass to the container.

HardLimit.Documentation: // The hard limit for the ulimit type.

SoftLimit.Documentation: // The soft limit for the ulimit type.

AgentVersion.Documentation: // The version number of the Amazon ECS container agent.
